chat.msg: Welcome!
hello
Hello! I'm ready to navigate through the map, what's our first direction?
You'll first be starting at the map at the top right corner
Got it! I see the map from the top right corner. What's our next step?
Then you will cross to the island on the left using that branch as a bridge
Ok, I crossed the branch to the left and arrived at the small island. What's next?
on the left side of the new island there is another branch for you to cross over
Thanks for your instruction! Now I crossed the branch and arrived on a new island. Could you tell me what I should do next?
then you want to walk around the bird so you would pass inbetween the bird and elephant
Great! Now I walked around the bird and passed between the bird and the elephant. What's the next step?
then on the right side of the island cross the rock bridge
Thank you for your guidance! I crossed the rock bridge on the right side of the island. What's next?
on the new island pass the frog, then loop back and walk over the aligator
Ok, I passed the frog and looped back to walk over the alligator. Where should I head next?
after passing the black rock go over the rocks on the left side of the island next to the giraffe
Alright, I passed the black rock and went over the rocks on the left side of the island next to the giraffe. What's the next step?
at the bottom of that island walk on the branch bridge and walk straight to the chest
Thank you for your guidance! I walked on the branch bridge downwards and walked straight to the treasure. *Finished*.

chat.msg: Welcome!
hello
Hi! I'm the navigator and I see a map with a white dog at the starting point. Can you tell me where to go from here?
from the white dog walk left to the stand and go slightly down
Okay, I see a wooden branch leading left from the white dog. I'll follow it and head slightly down. Do I keep going left or turn right at the end of the branch?
then go to the right where the log is under the original dog and walk across it

Got it! I'll head right from the end of the wooden branch and find the log under the original white dog. I'll walk across it. 

Do I continue straight after crossing the log or do I have to take another turn?
once you cross it go straight until you get to the picnic then take a left through the picnic and cross the log that is at the top left corner of the picnic blanket

Thanks for the instruction. So after crossing the log, I will go straight until I get to the picnic. Then I will take a left and cross the log that is at the top left corner of the picnic blanket.

Now, do I take a specific direction after crossing the log again or do I just continue straight?
then you should see a bush, go right and wrap around the bush until you hit the bridge
then go straight across the bridge and take a left between the two people on the bench and the log
after that go under the log, then to the right pass the bush above the deer and go straight to the deer head

Great! After crossing the log at the top left corner of the picnic blanket, I'll head towards the bush. I'll take a right turn and wrap around the bush, looking for the bridge.

Once I get to the bridge, do I need to go straight onto it or take another turn?

Alright. After crossing the bridge, I'll go straight and head towards the two people on the bench. I will take a left between the two people on the bench and the log.

Am I supposed to take any turns after that or do I need to continue straight?

Got it! I will go under the log and then turn right, pass the bush above the deer and go straight to the deer head. 

That should be it, have I reached the brown deer?

chat.msg: Welcome!
hello
Hello! I'm the navigator here, ready to take your instructions to navigate on the map. What would you like me to do?
At the start of the camping tent go down on the left side between the rock hill and the dog, then touch the walking trail when you are near the grill

Ok, got it. I'm currently standing near the camping tent at the north of the map. I'll start by walking down the left side, passing between the rock hill and the dog. Along the way, I'll keep an eye out for the grill and touch the walking trail when I'm near it. 

(As I walk down, I see the dog on my left and the rock hill on my right. Further down, I spot the grill on my right and veer towards the walking trail.) 

Alright, I'm on the walking trail now, just near the grill. What's next?
then walk up and around the campfire then return to the trail on the right side near the mushroom

Great, I'm turning around and walking up and around the campfire. (As I walk around the campfire, I see the dog again on my left and the fire on my right. Then, I spot the trail on my right side and return to it, keeping an eye out for the red mushroom.) 

Alright, I'm on the trail again, currently on the right side near the red mushroom. What's next?
walk a little bit forward to the car then turn around on the trail and take a left down the trail

Okay, got it. I'm walking forward towards the blue car. (As I walk towards the car, I spot it on my right side.) 

Now, I'll turn around on the trail and take a left down the trail. (I turn around and face the opposite direction. Then, I spot the trail on my left side and start moving in that direction.)

So, I'm walking down the trail to the left. What should I do next?
then walk around the telescope the right side and then go between the telescope and the bush until you arrive back on the trail

Okay, I understand. I'm currently walking down the trail. (As I walk, I see a blue telescope on my left and continue walking down.)

Now, I'll turn right and walk around the telescope. (I turn right and circle the telescope.) 

Next, I'll go between the telescope and the bush on my left until I return back to the trail. (I spot the bush and move to my left side while carefully navigating around it. Finally, I return back to the trail.)

Okay, I'm back on the trail. What's next?
then take a left on the trail and go up between the line of rocks that touch the telescope and the circle of rocks around the cabin then go to the cabin

Great, I got it. I'll turn left on the trail and go up. (I turn left and start walking up the trail.) 

Now, I see a line of rocks that are touching the telescope on the left and the circle of rocks around the cabin on the right. I'm going to walk up between them. (As I walk up between the two lines of rocks, I spot the wooden cabin in the distance.) 

Finally, I'll keep moving forward until I arrive at the wooden cabin. (I keep moving forward and soon reach the wooden cabin.) 

Alright, I've arrived at the wooden cabin. Does that mean I've reached the final object on the map and finished the navigation?

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I think it is fine if people do it if it make them more comfortable.

Any final comments about your language background?
